<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<!DOCTYPE taglib PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD JSP Tag Library 
1.1//EN" "http://java.sun.com/j2ee/dtds/web-jsptaglibrary_1_1.dtd">
<taglib>
  <tlibversion>1.0</tlibversion>
  <jspversion>1.1</jspversion>
  <shortname>botfighters</shortname>
  <uri>/</uri>
  <info>
Contains specific BotFighters tags
</info>
  <tag>
    <name>text</name>
    <tagclass>botfighters.tags.TextTag</tagclass>
    <bodycontent>JSP</bodycontent>
        <attribute>
                <name>textKey</name>
                <required>yes</required>
                <rtexprvalue>true</rtexprvalue>
        </attribute>
  </tag>
  <tag>
    <name>file</name>
    <tagclass>botfighters.tags.FileTag</tagclass>
    <bodycontent>JSP</bodycontent>
        <attribute>
                <name>path</name>
                <required>yes</required>
                <rtexprvalue>true</rtexprvalue>
        </attribute>
        <attribute>
                <name>fileName</name>
                <required>yes</required>
                <rtexprvalue>true</rtexprvalue>
        </attribute>
        <attribute>
                <name>suffix</name>
                <required>yes</required>
                <rtexprvalue>true</rtexprvalue>
        </attribute>
  </tag>
</taglib>

text:
Most likely explanation is that you have a servlet.jar from an older servlet 
container in your Java system extensions directory ($JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/ext).
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
